name: Mistress of the Mirror
description: Detective Dixon Hill is pulled into a real life mystery when Deanna Troi seeks out his help in finding her missing mother, Lwaxana Troi! Help determine whether this is a simple missing person case--or a full-blown murder mystery!
rules:
-- Unique Federation and Terran Empire Faction Missions are available during the event. Open the Event to access them.
-- Using any version of Georgiou, L. Troi, or Picard will provide a bonus to Event Faction Missions.
-- Every Event Faction Mission you succeed at earns you Event Victory Points. Collect Victory Points to unlock Event Threshold Rewards.
-- In this event, Squadrons may also compete to advance up the Squadron leaderboards. Join a Squadron to get more rewards!
bonus_text: Crew Bonus: Georgiou, L. Troi, or Picard
rewards_teaser: Reach Rank 1 by gaining Victory Points from Event Missions!

featured_crew.name: Nona
featured_crew.flavor: Fighting for what she believes is right, Nona betrays her husband to stop her people from becoming rulers.

featured_crew.name: Picard
featured_crew.flavor: In his spare time, Picard enjoyed participating in the Dixon Hill collection of holonovels."

rewards.name: Honor
rewards.flavor: Honor is gained by dismissing crew who have served you well, but are ready for reassignment. Redeem in the Time Portal for exclusive crew, special fusion-related items, training programs, and more.

rewards.flavor: Use to instantly revive a failed Voyage.

screens.text: "Of all the offices in all of San Francisco, she walked into mine. A petite, dark-haired little ingenue worried about her dear mother, with whom she lost contact a short time ago."

"Her mother, an ambassador, the coquettish Lwaxana Troi, went silent after slippin' over to the wrong side of the tracks. You might call me a softie, but I couldn't have a sweet thing like her charging into the snake's den of the Terran Empire to try and find her mother."

"Such childish amusements! This is why the Federation is hopelessly weak! You all spend your time indulging in fantasy rather than seizing the fruits of reality. Well, here's a dose of truth for you--we have no idea who this Lwaxana Troi is, or what happened to her."
"Can't say I fancy dealing with a ball-bustin' Terran broad like yourself. As to whether or not the elder Miss Troi was kidnapped, the truth, as they say, will out."
